title: Stock Futures Tick Up Ahead of Earnings; JPMorgan Chase, BlackRock and Delta Air Lines are due to report results before the opening bell
text:
Europe stocks declined Wednesday for a two-session losing streak. The Stoxx Europe 600 shed 0.2% in morning trade. Consumer staples and real-estate sectors drove the losses while financials and materials sectors rose.

Tesco fell 3.9% and Hammerson slipped 5.2%.

The U.K.'s FTSE 100 was lower 0.1%. Other stock indexes in Europe also mostly slipped as France's CAC 40 fell 0.2%, the U.K.'s FTSE 250 lost 0.3% and Germany's DAX was down 0.5%.

The British pound depreciated 0.2% against the U.S. dollar, with 1 pound buying $1.30 whereas the Swiss franc and the euro were broadly flat against the dollar.

In commodities, international benchmark Brent crude slipped 0.3% to $104.32 a barrel. Gold was also down 0.3% to $1,970.10 a troy ounce.

German 10-year bund yields gained to 0.844% and the yield on U.K. 10-year gilts strengthened to 1.860%. The yield on 10-year U.S. Treasury rose to 2.767% from 2.724%. Bond prices and yields move in opposite directions.

Stocks in Asia were mixed as Hong Kong's Hang Seng climbed 0.7% after falling as much as 0.8% during the session and Japan's Nikkei 225 index added 1.9%, whereas China's benchmark Shanghai Composite was down 0.8%.

Stock Futures Tick Up Ahead of Earnings
